heading: # Selects
headingText: Select fields components are used for collecting user provided information from a list of options.
objectAlert: When using objects for the **items** prop, you must associate **item-text** and **item-value** with existing properties on your objects. These values are defaulted to **text** and **value** and can be changed.
autoAlert: The **auto** property of **menu-props** is only supported for the default input style.
autocompleteAlert: Browser autocomplete is set to off by default, may vary by browser and may be ignored. [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Securing_your_site/Turning_off_form_autocompletion)

light.heading: ### Light theme
light.desc: A standard single select has a multitude of configuration options.

icons.heading: ### Icons
icons.desc: Use a custom prepended or appended icon.

multiple.heading: ### Multiple
multiple.desc: A multi-select can utilize `v-chip` as the display for selected items.

custom-text-and-value.heading: ### Customized item text and value
custom-text-and-value.desc: You can specify the specific properties within your items array correspond to the text and value fields. By default, this is **text** and **value**. In this example we also use the `return-object` prop which will return the entire object of the selected item on selection.

slots.heading: ### Prepend/Append item slots
slots.desc: The `v-select` components can be optionally expanded with prepended and appended items. This is perfect for customized **select-all** functionality.

selection-appearance.heading: ### Change selection appearance
selection-appearance.desc: The `selection` slot can be used to customize the way selected values are shown in the input. This is great when you want something like `foo (+20 others)` or don't want the selection to occupy multiple lines.

dense.heading: ### Dense
dense.desc: You can use `dense` prop to reduce the field height and lower max height of list items.

readonly.heading: ### Read-only
readonly.desc: You cannot use read-only `v-select`, but it looks default.

menu-props.heading: ### Custom menu props
menu-props.desc: Custom props can be passed directly to `v-menu` using `menuProps` prop. In this example menu is force directed to top and shifted to top.

props.autocomplete: Filter the items in the list based on user input
props.cacheItems: Keeps a local _unique_ copy of all items that have been passed through the **items** prop.
props.chips: Changes display of selections to chips
props.debounceSearch: Debounces the search input value being emitted
props.deletableChips: Adds a remove icon to selected chips
props.filter: The function used for filtering items
props.hideSelected: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected
props.items: Can be an array of objects or array of strings. When using objects, will look for a text and value field. This can be changed using the **item-text** and **item-value** props.  Objects that have a **header** or **divider** property are considered special cases and generate a list header or divider; these items are not selectable.
props.itemValue: Set property of **items**'s value - **must be primitive**. Dot notation is supported. **Note:** This is currently not supported with `v-combobox` [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/issues/5479)
props.menuProps: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts either a string for boolean props `menu-props="auto, overflowY"`, or an object `:menu-props="{ auto: true, overflowY: true }"`
props.minWidth: Sets the minimum width of the select's `v-menu` content
props.multiple: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value
props.multiLine: Causes label to float when the select component is focused or dirty
props.noDataText: Display text when there is no data
props.openOnClear: When using the **clearable** prop, once cleared, the select menu will either open or stay open, depending on the current state
props.returnObject: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**
props.searchInput: Use the **.sync** modifier to catch user input from the search input
props.smallChips: Changes display of selections to chips with the **small** property
props.tags: Tagging functionality, allows the user to create new values not available from the **items** prop
props.valueComparator: The comparison algorithm used for values. [More info](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/blob/master/packages/vuetify/src/util/helpers.ts)

slots.append-item: Adds an item after menu content
slots.prepend-item: Adds an item before menu content

events.update:list-index: Emitted when menu item is selected using keyboard arrows
